{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3731094,"name":"Kai","username":"kcoleman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T18:15:00.538Z","cooked":"

Hey everyone,

My team is working on a small electric kart project for the Waterloo EV Challenge, and we wanted to power it with Kraken X60s. Since the motors have integrated controllers, I’d like to keep things as simple as possible for control.

Ideally, I’d like to use CAN for communication instead of PWM (less wiring, more reliable).

  • Goal is just basic throttle control, nothing fancy.

  • I’m looking for the simplest way to interface with the Krakens — whether that’s using a specific CAN interface, firmware, or a plug-and-play solution.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T18:17:32.646Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":89.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505958,"topic_slug":"controlling-kraken-x60s-for-a-kart-waterloo-ev-race","display_username":"Kai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65823,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/controlling-kraken-x60s-for-a-kart-waterloo-ev-race/505958/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3731098,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T18:18:40.528Z","cooked":"

You can use the normal Phoenix 6 library outside of FRC with a USB-to-CAN adapter (just CANivore on Windows, other ones work on Linux as well).

Phoenix 6

Installing Phoenix 6 (non-FRC)

Phoenix 6 is fully supported outside of FRC on supported systems with a USB to CAN adapter. Installation: Installation is composed of a few primary pieces. Users may skip CANivore installation if t...

Pwm works just fine too!

I’m looking for a way to control it using an off-the-shelf foot throttle. How could I go about converting its output into a USB-CAN adaptor or PWM to the motor?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T18:27:55.362Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":189,"readers_count":188,"score":57.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":505958,"topic_slug":"controlling-kraken-x60s-for-a-kart-waterloo-ev-race","display_username":"Kai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65823,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/controlling-kraken-x60s-for-a-kart-waterloo-ev-race/505958/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3731109,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T18:33:41.706Z","cooked":"

Foot pedal to Arduino to PWM is going to be way simpler than foot pedal to PC to CAN.

Foot pedal will be either a potentiometer or a hall sensor, read it off the analog input to the arduino, output a proportional PWM onto the Krakens, maybe tune the conversion mapping a little bit so its not linear.

Also why do you want to run a kart on krakens

you can probably get CIMs for free

Think one could find a footpedal that just outputs PWM and skip the microcontroller?

It’s an endurance race, so we need to maintain a low power usage. Krakens are what the top teams are using now, and my teacher decided he wants to buy them. The whole race is over 70/90 minutes.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-09-04T18:36:55.780Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":34.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505958,"topic_slug":"controlling-kraken-x60s-for-a-kart-waterloo-ev-race","display_username":"Kai","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28019,"username":"s-neff","name":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65823,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/controlling-kraken-x60s-for-a-kart-waterloo-ev-race/505958/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3731115,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-04T18:44:51.950Z","cooked":"

Not in a four minute google search…. the Arduino is flexible enough to accept any sensing setup on a pedal and the three COTS pedal listings I checked are just “fits trike X” or “3 pin connector” with no details on whats actually happening under the hood.

Best case you find a pedal that outputs hobby PWM, but honestly I’d be pretty surprised if that existed.

We compete in the Waterloo EV challenge as well, and use X60s for both of our vehicles. We use a CANivore to relay CAN to all of our devices. Beyond that, I’m not as certain because I don’t work on that project as much as our FRC projects.
